WRITING.TITLE: Free at last, free at last. Thank God almighty, free at last.
Design help for reddit upvote/downvote system
WRITING.TEXT: I'm working on a site and want to incorporate an up/down vote system. Two ways jump out at me: 1) user_id, obj_id, rating. user_id amp; obj_id are a paired key and rating either stores 1 or -1. 2) user_id, obj_id, upvote, downvote. Paired key is the same as #1 but depending on which the user checked, the appropriate column gets flagged. I've implemented scenario #1 but was curious if the other is better. Any thoughts on which of the two is better? Thanks for your insight.

ratings of 0 are not being stored. I only store a 1 (upvote) or -1 (downvote). When I access the view object page, I get the up/down vote count with the following query (not single select either): SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ratings WHERE rating = 1 AND obj_id = " . $this- gt;id . ") AS likes, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ratings WHERE rating = -1 AND obj_id = " . $this- gt;id . ") AS dislikes
I changed my design to scenario #2. I found I was able to get more powerful results from single queries.

My lunch box... This wasn't an ordinary lunchbox though. I bought an ammunition box that I called my lunch box. I drilled holes in the top and installed four blinking LEDs that never stopped blinking. I drilled a hole in the back that had an internal connection to a CD player that I carried inside of it; this way I could plug my headphones "into the box." This thing was covered with stickers of the bands I liked. This never left my side and I carried it everywhere. I do not think anyone would be allowed to get away with this nowadays.

American here but I'm an immigrant from Israel. My family is originally from the Soviet Union and of course, I have relatives that fought in the Red Army against the Nazis. I heard some great stories about them shooting up those Schwein. I agree, Americans don't get it. It's one thing to read about it in a book; it's something different when I can call my grandparents and ask...
Absolutely,yes. But from my friends and the people I know, it's a no. The only people that shared that were the ones from the European side, not over here.

WRITING.TITLE: Where do fan sites get their data from?
WRITING.TEXT: Where do sites like puzzledragonx.com and pad.wikia.com get the data for all of the monsters, dungeons, etc. from? Is there a central DB on gungho's site that offers the data or something along those lines? I'm currently crawling one of the sites I mentioned to retrieve the data and store a local copy of it but if there was a central location, I would be so happy. I'm a developer and want to write some scripts that will do a number of things to make my life easier. Even if the things I wanted to do exist, I still want to create my own stuff for fun. Thanks

That's exactly what I want. As of now, I'm crawling pdx.com and compiling XML files on the fly and storing them for further analysis. Once I have enough stats pulled from their site, I'll build an actual DB where I can run some powerful queries for even more analysis. But the amount of data the game has is way way way too much for them to just get it from playing...
Yeah, it's like "too perfect" for them to not be affiliated or something with GungHo.

I have a rooted android so I was able to get all of the files stored in the data directory. If the game really is fully loaded on the phone, then those stats must be buried somewhere in one of those files. it then becomes a matter of analyzing the files to try and find the right ones. Does anyone have access to these files that's not version 6.1.0? Maybe a simple file size difference can help isolate the correct set?
Exactly! All of the data on all of the sites, apps, etc. I just don't believe it's not parsed from something.
Awesome. I hope they respond and please share your findings.
What about the Dub-mythlit? I've completed it twice now and have gotten nothing. 25/play is a lot but if i get something, it's worth it. According to padx, it says 100% drop rate. What gives though?
Oh I didn't get that. Then should I bother playing this? I need it for a couple huge evos but I'm getting annoyed.
Well of course but who knows when that'll be again... I don't want to wait forever.
Now I played so many times and got so many dubs, that I need two dub-mythlits. First world problems...
I didn't realize those were invasions. I've definitely had that and it's awesome. It just sucks having to wait for it.

WRITING.TITLE: Playing with bin files.
WRITING.TEXT: I know there are two bin files that store game data. I've read with rooted phones, people play multiple accounts by loading/reloading different bins. My question is this. I also preface this with I know this is cheap but let's say I play a board. I don't get the drop I was hoping for. Can't I just reload the bins and try again until I get what I want? If the board is difficult, don't I have "infinite" stamina to try it until I get it? Thanks.
How are stats modifiable?

Oh man. Hill of Iris is the 16th tech dungeon. I'm only on #8 Shrine of Liquid Flame. And these boards are pretty rough cause I dont really have anything too fancy. A couple good pulls that I evolved but mostly it's all dragons I'm advancing.

Well there are classes to download with that load the html and you can traverse the code through a series of routines and what not. I always seem to have a mental block when it comes to those so I'm just looking at the code and doing regular expressions against the parts that contain the info I need and pull it out. It's hardly the right way to do it but it's working.

WRITING.TITLE: Legendary Evil Dragon Drop
WRITING.TEXT: I really want that Evil Dragon Helhiem. I've completed expert about five or six times but haven't gotten it. I know the drop rate on master is much higher but I'm just not strong enough yet to complete it. Given that last time this dungeon was available was about 6 months ago, should I just keep playing expert until I get it? Am I just delusional and wasting all of my stamina or there's actually a chance for it? Thanks
I already have him and he's awesome. But that one just looks totally badass. Plus with an ultimate evo, he doubles up on purple attack and is 40x, not 20x.
Yeah I was playing yesterday during x2 but it then ended. I don't know when the next one is so I don't want to miss it.

Damn three drops, that's awesome. I don't have anything too special or good. Mostly the most evolved versions of the starter dragons and "lil x dragon." I use Chaos Devil as my leader for defense and then usually Lightning Holy Dragon, Echidna (for delay), and Tyrannos or something. The partner I pick is a an attack multiplier, don't know the name but for every combo above 3, it multiplies by 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, etc.. all attacks, That's very helpful for almost all stages but the knights on the highest level here just massacre me.
Ok. Sounds like I'm going to hold off on this dungeon until then. I just got a Pterra so hopefully I can get it to the highest level by then and have another powerful white dragon helping me.
Also, maybe I should pick two chaos dragon leaders. That way all damage is quartered and I might stand a chance....

WRITING.TITLE: World War III has begun, but no one seems to acknowledge it.
WRITING.TEXT: So many countries coming together to bomb ISIS; seems like a world war to me.

http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/war : a state or period of fighting between countries or groups : a situation in which people or groups compete with or fight against each other : an organized effort by a government or other large organization to stop or defeat something that is viewed as dangerous or bad Head count not mentioned...
It's the giant squid in the room that no one wants to talk about. http://img.fark.net/images/cache/850/m/mt/fark_mtFAVAwGYusMIuNuDVLoIl8LgLA.png?t=spuN1fmNJlpBD28n0uOTrQ amp;f=1411963200

World War I was primarily fought in Europe, one place. I think random isolated conflicts are opposite of a WW. Israel fighting Hamas, localized and just them. Mexican cartels trying to seize power, also local and just them. But the fact that so many countries are coming together to attack a group, makes it a WW. The reason everyone is going after ISIS is because they threaten not just their locale, but the world.
Please re-read the definition of war. Keep reading it until it soaks in. THIS IS A WAR! WAKE UP!
I guess that's why the giant squid is in the room. People like the blinders for whatever reason.

I don't have cable TV and get my news exclusively from here. Do I think ISIS poses a threat great enough to start a world war? Yes, hence this post. If I didn't, "we wouldn't be here." Furthermore, the fact that, I don't know, ten plus countries are coming together to bomb them, that is a response because of their threat. If this was just chicken shit, there wouldn't be such a global response.
Not to beat a dead horse but just saw somewhere it's fifty countries now against ISIS. Nah, not a world war at all.

WRITING.TITLE: What's the max on fairies? I've managed to get 11.
16 fairies! I definitely think I hit the max this time.

WRITING.TEXT: Haven't seen it for about a week now.
I totally agree. These aren't necessary whatsoever but it's something other than looking for turd piles.

Then hold five, release them and quickly pause. Hold onto as many to have only two left. Back to game and they'll respawn, put away what you're holding, quickly pick up the five you dropped and grab the new spawns. You have to do this all really quick with full stealth on. I started with 12, dropped the 5, hold 5 and that's how I got the 16.
Yeah more or less. Play around with it and you'll get the feel for it.
Southwest is Gerudo territory; southeast is the fishing village
Can you get into it and explore?

Start with what this guy said: gt; 7 in inventory. Hold 5 of them, 4 spawn. gt; Pocket the 5, pick up the 4, now there's 11 in inventory. Except instead of 7, you'll have 3/4. Whatever you have, hold enough until you only have 2 in inventory. They respawn, put away, grab those then you have more. Keep doing this until you have to let them go, then hold, then spawn, then quickly scoop up. Edit: formatting
Np. Were you able to get it working?
Since you don't have to let these go, walk out of the fountain then hold the five and walk towards the fountain. While you're still holding them, you should see the new ones spawn.
